results.title: In continuo
results.creator_credit: Vlatko Gilic, Phoenix Films and Dunav Film
results.brief_description: Non-narrated treatment of the activities carried out in an abattoir. An unlikely subject for a documentary, but the filmmaker captures the strength and terrible beauty in the daily preparation for slaughter. The sound track echoes with hard metallic knives being ground, tested and sharpened. No beast is actually shown being killed but the slaughter is mirrored in the blood-red faces of the men and the scenes of water flushing away the blood to a river - thus water purges but never really cleans the walls of the slaughter house. A powerful film - almost abstract at times. Perhaps even more effective because of what it leaves unsaid and unshown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vlatko Gilic, Phoenix Films and Dunav Film

results.title: In cold blood : the massacre of East Timor
results.creator_credit: Peter Gordon, Max Stahl and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: Produced originally as a segment for the Yorkshire Television program “First Tuesday”. The Island of East Timor was annexed by Indonesia in 1975 and has suffered military occupation ever since. In 1991 troops opened fire on a funeral procession in Dili - the bloody massacre that ensued was captured on film by a Yorkshire Television camaraman and became headline news around the world. That footage is backed up in this documentary by frank and moving interviews with Timorese who describe the succession of atrocities inflicted on them dating back to 1975.

results.title: In cold blood
results.brief_description: Truman Capote’s account of the slaughter of a Kansas farming family by two violent drifters has been transformed into a chilling and brutal examination of the nature of violence by director Richard Brooks. The almost paradaisical black and white cinemtography seduces the viewer who is then confronted by the horrific reality of psychotic murder. “In Cold Blood”, as does Capote in his novel, refuses easy moralising, simple sociological explanations and resists turning the material into melodrama or conforming to the dictates of the gangster genre. Edited with sharp precision, this film shocked American viewers on its release by revealing the sadism and ugliness underneath the frontier myth of rural America. Music by Quincy Jones. Starring Robert Blake.

results.title: In celebration
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Ely Landau and Almo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Atmospheric adaptation of David Storey’s emotionally charged play, about three sons who return to their Yorkshire mining town for their parent’s wedding anniversary - an event that stirs up suppressed resentment, childhood memories and bitterness, despite the men’s successful lives. Impressive performances from Alan Bates, James Bolam and Brian Cox who reprise their stage roles as the three middle class sons. Part of the American Film Theatre Collection.

results.title: In case of fire. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Stresses that heat, smoke and poisonous gases are the elements that can kill in a fire. Outlines ways in which to avoid fire hazards in the home. Shows what to do should a fire break out in the house or apartment building when occupied.

results.title: In case of emergency
results.brief_description: A look at the German Red Cross, the Technical Aid Movement and the Fire Brigade. These voluntary helpers, trained in their spare time, go abroad to assist in disasters.

results.title: In black and white
results.creator_credit: John Rawdon, Hindle Marriott Edgar, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Presents paper as the mainstay of civilisation and as an instrument of immortality for the works of great men. Follows the development of paper-making from the production of single sheets by hand and then (early 19th century) by machine from rag-pulp. Perfected by an Englishman on the basis of a French invention, and fed by wood-pulp as suggested by the French scientist Reaumur a century before, this machine grew into the giant production lines seen at the close of the film.

results.title: In Between. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Mandy Smith and Kim Dalton
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “In Between” a series of dramas set in Melbourne that looks at the pressures of growing up. Episode Three looks at Angie who is bright, tough and enjoys life. However, life is suddenly more complicated when she discovers that she is pregnant. Episode Four is about Alex who is confused by the different pressures that his father and friends place upon him to grow up.

results.title: In Between. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Chris Dalton, Mandy Smith, Kim Dalton and Chris Warner
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “In Between” a series of dramas set in Melbourne that looks at the pressures of growing up. Episode One is about Fatima who wants to be a journalist. However, her father believes that Fatima should leave school and return to Turkey to an arranged marriage. Episode Two is about Saret who is an illegal immigrant from Cambodia.

results.title: In between
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Mandy Smith and Kim Dalton
results.brief_description: A mini series of four one-hour episodes, each of which concentrates primarly on one of the four major characters (Fatima, Saret, Angie and Alex) but also, advances the stories of three other characters. We learn of their relationships with friends and neighbours,their families and their workplaces.
